org.epics.graphene

Interface Cell1DDataset


  • public interface Cell1DDataset
    Dataset consisting of a value for each cell of a 1D grid.

    It represents values distributed on a 1D grid and their statistical information.

    Author:
    carcassi

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Statistics getStatistics()
      Returns the statistics of all values at all cells.
      double getValue(int x)
      Returns the value at the given coordinates.
      org.epics.util.array.ListNumber getXBoundaries()
      Returns the boundaries of the cells along x.
      int getXCount()
      The number of cells defined along the x direction.
      Range getXRange()
      The range along x.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        double getValue(int x)
        Returns the value at the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        Returns:
        the value
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if x $lt; 0 or x >= getXCount()

      • getStatistics

        Statistics getStatistics()
        Returns the statistics of all values at all cells.

        If the the grid has zero cells, or if all values are NaN, it returns null.

        Returns:
        statistical information; null if no actual value is defined on the grid

      • getXBoundaries

        org.epics.util.array.ListNumber getXBoundaries()
        Returns the boundaries of the cells along x.

        The number of elements matches getXCount() + 1. If no cells are defined, it will return null. The boundaries are ordered from the smallest to the greatest.

        Returns:
        the boundaries of the cells; null if 0 cells are defined

      • getXRange

        Range getXRange()
        The range along x.

        Effectively the first and last elements of getXBoundaries(). If no cells are defined, it will return null.

        Returns:
        the range along x; null if 0 cells are defined

      • getXCount

        int getXCount()
        The number of cells defined along the x direction.
        Returns:
        the number of cells along x
